intro: Windmannia rhodoxylon, commonly known as the redwood windmannia, is a member of the Onagraceae family. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and showy, four-petaled flowers that are often pink or red in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Windmannia rhodoxylon is adapted to well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade environments.
